exposes the Nim VM to clients.

Imports

ast, astalgo, modules, passes, condsyms, options, sem, semdata, llstream, vm, vmdef, modulegraphs, idents, pathutils, passaux, scriptconfig

Types

Interpreter = ref object
  mainModule: PSym
  graph: ModuleGraph
  scriptName: string
Use Nim as an interpreter with this object   Source Edit

Procs

proc selectUniqueSymbol(i: Interpreter; name: string;
                       symKinds: set[TSymKind] = {skLet, skVar}): PSym {...}{.raises: [],
    tags: [].}
Can be used to access a unique symbol of name and the given symKinds filter.   Source Edit 
proc selectRoutine(i: Interpreter; name: string): PSym {...}{.raises: [], tags: [].}
Selects a declared routine (proc/func/etc) from the main module. The routine needs to have the export marker *. The only matching routine is returned and nil if it is overloaded.   Source Edit

    JsonParsingError], tags: [RootEffect, WriteIOEffect, ReadIOEffect, ReadEnvEffect,
                            TimeEffect, ReadDirEffect, ExecIOEffect].}
  Source Edit

proc evalScript(i: Interpreter; scriptStream: PLLStream = nil) {...}{.raises: [OSError,
    KeyError, Exception, ValueError, IOError, ERecoverableError], tags: [
    ReadDirEffect, RootEffect, WriteIOEffect, ReadEnvEffect, ReadIOEffect].}
This can also be used to reload the script.   Source Edit 
proc findNimStdLib(): string {...}{.raises: [],
                            tags: [ReadDirEffect, ReadEnvEffect, ReadIOEffect].}
Tries to find a path to a valid "system.nim" file. Returns "" on failure.   Source Edit 
proc findNimStdLibCompileTime(): string {...}{.raises: [], tags: [ReadDirEffect].}
Same as findNimStdLib but uses source files used at compile time, and asserts on error.   Source Edit
